comments: I had to drop her online class because of how unorganized and unclear her blackboard was. Nothing is in order and I learned absolutely nothing. I took this class because I wanted to learn how to write papers properly, but this ended up to be a big waste of time. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS.

comments: Worst professor I\'ve had to date. All assignments are confusing, unorganized, and scattered all over the classes blackboard. She would leave and put off grading within a CONDENSED COURSE. Like really? During a condensed course you decide to leave town? Do not take.

comments: I\'m taking this class online as a condensed class, so only about 9 weeks long. I would not recommend doing that. Her assignments are extremely confusing and the "instructions" were up to 12 paragraphs long. One instruction for an essay was to make part of it bold. When I got my feedback for the paper, she was confused why I had bold. Very unclear.

comments: Took her for ENGL 111 online. Horrible professor. She didn\'t have the syllabus up for the first month. She couldn\'t figure out the online book/assignments but expected that the student have them done. She would assign homework and papers with 3+ pages midday and have them due that evening.

comments: Had this professor for English 212 online. What ever you do do not take this class. She assigns homework whenever basically. Shr doesnt know how to use the online ebook: where you do the assignments. she decides to make groups at the end of the semester where she "hopes" you communicate with each other. which is completely pointless.

comments: It took less than a week to realize that this professor and I would not get along. I became exasperated by her confusing assignments. It seemed like the rest of the class had the same problem, as she would send out email after email attempting to explain herself. For an English professor, she is a very poor communicator. I\'m glad I dropped it.

comments: Ms. Sims changes directions for assignments repeatedly, doesn\'t follow the syllabus, doesn\'t clarify with inquiries, and is condescending. She takes forever to grade, gives very little time for assignments, is an incredibly hard grader (ironic based on hot mess direction), and communicates very poorly. For a 200 level course, WAY too much work.

comments: Her teaching is completely difficult to understand. She rarely followed her syllabus. It got confusing on whenwhat was due. comments: Ms. Sims changes what she wants done on an assignment numerous times. She does like being questioned on an assignment that you don\'t understand. Instructions are not clear. She does allow you to rewrite your paperwork; however, full credit is typically still not given. Takes a long time to grade your assignments. Comments on papers are confusing.

comments: Her over all personality is great.. but her teaching is another story. I personally feel she is very hectic. We had a syllabus but rarely followed it. It got confusing on what was due and what wasn\'t due. I work full time and go to school, so in my opinion it was hard to keep up with the class. Learned ALOT though even if it was kind of hard.

comments: Cynthia definitely makes your work, but she\'s fun, she\'s very clear on her instuctions, and she only wants you to do good. If you have any questions she will answer them.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (9)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (6)  Get ready to read (6)  GROUP PROJECTS (4)  SO MANY PAPERS (3)  Participation matters (2)  Caring (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)
comments: She is a smart lady, moves pretty quickly, and can come off condesending at times, but somehow I still earned an A. She wants you to be clear on how to do things, and gives you chances for rewrites. You will rely heavily on your group members, and group work is a must, although you still have to pull your weight. Overall, a good Professor.
